Preparing to Use View Manager

To ensure correct results, you should undertake some preliminary steps before you run View Manager.

Before using View Manager:

  • Minimize the data that must be replicated. If you do not need some objects, do not include them.

  • Back up the server before using View Manager.

  • Review the capabilities and limitations of View Manager.

    • View Manager works only with files. No change requests, requirements, topics, or tasks can be copied or synchronized.

    • Reference views cannot be copied without their parents, because a reference view and its parent view access the same files.

    • Replication of foreign archives is not supported. If  a project was created by wrapping PVCS and VSS files, its files must be converted to native format before being replicated.

    • If View Manager adds objects that are older than their new parent objects, it assigns them the current time rather than their original time. This is because the server will not accept the original time.

    For more details, see the StarTeam Administrator's Guide.
